comments.html: We used the poor man's version of it: old, unused patch panels.
comments.name: Andras Dosztal

comments.html: This comment has been removed by the author.
comments.name: Unknown

comments.html: I used tape - one long piece for top row another for bottom row, made sure to push it together between each cable.  But Heath Robinson, but did the job.  Long time since I've had to mess with cables myself though.
comments.name: Simon Hamilton-Wilkes

comments.html:
The worst thing is not cables being unlabelled, the worst thing is cables being connected in a totally random order, without any description anywhere, coming from all directions and occasionally not having enough extra length to move it a few cm right or left. Situation otherwise known as mess or disorder :)

For people refusing to label cables there's "PatchSee".
For everybody, there's "documentation" (if concept is known in the shop).
comments.name: R.-Adrian F.

comments.html: That's a pretty neat idea! I've always just used a fine point pen to write the port number on the patch lead.
comments.name: Anonymous
